item.description:
Dead of Winter: The Long Night is a standalone expansion for Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game that introduces the Raxxon location where horrible experiments will spill out into the town unless players can contain them.
The game has players at a new colony location trying to survive with new survivors against brand new challenges. Can you handle being raided by members of other colonies? Will you explore more and unravel the mysteries of the Raxxon pharmaceutical location to find powerful items but release stronger enemies? Or will you upgrade your colony to help it better withstand the undead horde? These are all choices you will get to make in this new set, and if you want, you can mix in the survivors and cards from the original set to increase the variety even more.

comment.value: Customisiming my DoW game! Heck yeah!

Before this expansion, the original set felt somewhat lacking to me. Unless you have a group willing to roleplay the game out with you (which is sadly rare in my case), everything came down to two choices for me - do the thing that benefits the colony or hold out for you own personal objectives But BOY the added modules do A LOT to make the game more exciting, while also not adding too much additional rules to keep track of! Raxxon adds an awesome element of risk vs reward - terrible TERRIBLE things can happen but at the same time there's some amazing game-saving items to be had if everything goes well. The special zombies make ALL of the zombies feel more like a threat rather than just a nuisance in the background because you have to kill those before any other zombies and they often have a much higher chance of killing your survivor in various different means, and the choice all the players have to make to contain them or use their dice to complete objectives is amazing. The bandits also add a wonderful increase in randomness and choices. If they get out of hand, they'll tear through location decks and take the things you want, and add even more zombies around you. However you can also use them to find the items that you want FOR you, because if your really successful with a search or attack at a bandit hideout, you can choose from any of the items in their pile! But at the same time doing those actions at that hideout can be more risky as it seems to be a more wound-prone alternative. Then finally the improvements module works really well for giving you opportunities to adjust to whatever hardships the game is throwing at you. For example, if you have a lot of helpless to feed, it's a real good idea to invest points into the greenhouse! Got some crazed item using players on your team? Invest in an outhouse! A lot more of the crossroad cards also seemed to go off, and one even interacted with another in a great way, showing the rivalry between two characters that I really appreciated. However I could have just gotten lucky because I could easily see combining the DoWs diluting the deck. Perhaps when I combine the DoW games I'll use a house rule where people will draw 2 or 3 cards if the previous was an 'If this character is in play' type. Any who, All of this does SO much to revitalize the game. The base game was rated about a 5 for me, but this one is definitely an 8 or 9 now. I also personally just jumped into the game using all the modules at once - it's not much to tack on if you already know the game, and they even have a section for just new rules that's easy to consume. ---Edit--- After a couple more games, my game group agrees. I've never had as many laughs or tense moments playing only the base set. I dont see myself going back!
Teleportation? Not sure I'm ready for teleportation.
Rating purely based on the new modules. They are fun, challenging and add difficulty but I can take them or leave them. Component upgrades, new survivors and item decks are great.

PLAID HAT GAMES (PLD10001) Dead of Winter: The Long Night is the new stand-alone expansion for Dead of Winter: A Crossroads game. Obtain more of everything that made Dead of Winter an epic struggle for power and survival! Experience a new colony full of new survivors and new gameplay elements, each of which is introduced to players through its own game scenario. Fight off bandits from another colony, build improvements to your colony, and most intriguingly, unravel the mysteries of the new Raxxon Pharmaceutical location. It is full of powerful items, but also full of Raxxon's twisted human experiments that show up in the game as disturbing new enemies. Dead of Winter: The Long Night can be bought alone and is a fully-realized Dead of Winter experience by itself. You can also combine everything - characters, items, objectives, crossroad cards, etc. - between The Long Night and the original Dead of Winter.
